Irisbond Duo API
  • notitle
Starting the API

Start the API and get the start status code

To start the API just execute start() and get the return code:

IrisbondDuo.START_STATUS status = IrisbondDuo.start();

START_STATUS can have different values that tell us whether the API started or not, and why (see IrisbondAPI::START_STATUS):

  • START_STATUS::START_OK The API started
  • START_STATUS::NO_CAMERA The eye tracker is not connected or the drivers are not installed.
  • START_STATUS::CAMERA_IN_USE The eye tracker is being used by other program and the API can't access it.
  • START_STATUS::CAMERA_ERROR The eye tracker is connected but can't start.

If the start status is not START_STATUS::START_OK, the API won't start. The cable or drivers must be checked before continue.

When the API starts properly (START_STATUS::START_OK), the infrared lights inside the eye tracker will blink very fast.

When the API is started, the CPU usage rises up to 100%. This is completely normal.

The callbacks that the developer will need to set in order to receive information from the API will be reseted every time the Start() function is called. So please, remember to set the callbacks EACH TIME and AFTER you call the start function to start the API. See High performance mode for a detailed explanation.

At this point, the API is ready to provide the gaze points from the user and perform other actions described in the following tutorials.

Stop the API

To stop the API just execute stop().

IrisbondDuo.stop();

The eye tracker leds will be off and the CPU usage will drop to a normal level.
